instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00164: What is 820-00164? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a Fan spins for a few seconds then nothing, sometimes boots
threads.message:
Hi there!

Have a MacBook Air 11 inch here that has the tiniest bit of water damage. didn't turn on. chucked it into the UC and it booted yay! But then it just tuned off. booted again and it was on even shorter. now it's just spinning the fan for a few seconds and won't boot at all. Problem is, since it's so inconsistent it's hard to pin point the issue. Any ideas?

Thanks!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a Fan spins for a few seconds then nothing, sometimes boots
threads.message: I assume you documented where the corrosion was before cleaning. The usual suspects apply, <CHIP>U1900</CHIP>, <CHIP>U1950</CHIP>, around <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> and crap under the SMC.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a Fan spins for a few seconds then nothing, sometimes boots
threads.message:
Yes, well thats the thing, it was so minimal. It was visible on one screw hole by the USB ports. and on the Diagnostic port which I removed. 
I cant see any sign of liquid around those chips. Checked some of the power rails and they all look present. It's the SMC right? I'm screwed arent I haha

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a Fan spins for a few seconds then nothing, sometimes boots
threads.message: First put some flux and heat on SMC, not full on reflow just let the flux boil away any possible crap under it.
